newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU to provide money for Portuguese dam project.
newsitem.headline: EU to provide money for Portuguese dam project.

text.p: The European Union will provide 203 million ecus ($215 million) to support a dam project in the Alqueva region of southern Portugal, one of the EU's least developed areas, the European Commission said on Monday.

"This project will help give (the inhabitants) the opportunity to bring the region's economy up to the level of that of the rest of Europe," EU Regional Policy Commissioner Monika Wulf-Mathies said in a statement.
The money will go to the PEDIZA regional development project, which aims to build a strategic water reserve on the River Guadiana, improve the area's infrastructure and modernise its industrial base.
The EU's contribution will cover 54 percent of the public expense involved, the Commission said.

The Alqueva region's 543,000 inhabitants have a per capita Gross Domestic Product that is only 42 percent of the EU average and an unemployment rate of 15 percent -- twice the national average, it added.
The programme will allow the region to modernise its agricultural sector by gradually bringing irrigation to 110,000 hectares (271,000 acres) of land, it added.

The Commission and the Portuguese government agreed various measures to ensure the project does not damage the environment, including setting up a monitoring committee that will include environmental group representatives.
